results.title: The Remarkable school house
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Peter Poor and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Shows new teaching methods in use, particularly computer applications, and discusses the changes in schools to be expected in coming decades. Reporter Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Remarkable riderless runaway tricycle
results.creator_credit: Evergreen Productions, John Sturner and Gary Templeton
results.brief_description: A humorous fantasy about a little boy’s tricycle which is mistakenly picked up by garbage collectors and taken to the tip. However, the tricycle mysteriously takes on a personality and a will of its own, escapes from the tip and returns to its owner - but not before having aroused the suspicion of the garbage collectors and the police road patrol. Based on the book by Bruce McNillan.

results.title: The Reluctant world power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The third in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. The period between 1914 and 1941 was one in which America was torn between the policies of isolationism and involvement outside its boundaries. Focuses on Wilson’s policies of involvement in European affairs during and after the First World War. A backlash caused a return to isolationism in the 1920s and 1930s which was followed by partial involvement in Europe at the beginning of World War II and America’s full commitment to the war in Europe and the Pacific in 1941.

results.title: The Reluctant dragon (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: A Walt Disney animated cartoon based on the story by Kenneth Grahame. Tells of a dragon and a knight who prefer to write poetry and drink tea than to fight. However, for the sake of tradition and to please the villagers, a somewhat unorthodox duel is staged.

results.title: The Reluctant delinquent
results.brief_description: Portrays the relationship of delinquency to learning disabilities using the case of Robbie Gamble, who is being held in a maximum security facility for juveniles. After many years of failure in school, he is learning to read in special education classes.

results.title: The Refracting glasses
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and David Perry
results.brief_description: Constant Malernik is an artist and filmmaker who is obsessed with modern art and revolutionary aesthetics. This amazing experimental film, interweaving documentary, rhapsodic naturalism and theatrical narrative, traces Constant’s attempts to liberate some hope from his disillusionment with the Communist experiment. We follow Constant and his camera to New York where he visits a touring Cubist exhibition, back to 1950’s Sydney where as a young man he confronts the ghost of Ern Malley (the fictional “surrealist” poet who was the product of a hoax which scandalised the Australian art community in the mid-century and resulted in a backlash against modernism which was to affect Australian culture for over two decades), and then finally to the Soviet Union where he is to witness the dismantling of the Communist empire he had believed in for so long. But parallel to Constant’s search for meaning there is the story of his partner Lydia, a Russian emigre, who returns to the Soviet Union with him to come to terms with her own place in her country’s tortured history. A study that encompasses politics, art, revolution and the meaning of what it is to be Australian this significant film is proof that the most daring and original Australian film is coming from outside the mainstream.

results.title: The Reformation: age of revolt
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Signet Productions and Paul Asselin
results.brief_description: This film consists mainly of role playing by major contestants in the Reformation: Luther, Pope Hadrian, Erasmus, Emperor Charles, John Calvin and others. Each put their case quoting statements from their writings. Also includes a dramatisation of the Peasants’ War and contemporary sketches and drawings. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Reformation
results.brief_description: Explains the Reformation in terms of the Church, the cultural rebirth brought about by the Renaissance, the emergence of national states and the interpretation of the Scriptures. Special attention is devoted to Luther and the Protestant Reformation in Germany. No other credits available.

results.title: The Refiners fire
results.creator_credit: Entropy, Doubleday Multi Media, K Beasley, R. Grossman and C Hemenway
results.brief_description: A film produced by high school students, employing animated squares and circles depicting a situation in which a person with new ideas, may influence some, but is often persecuted by the majority. Provides a discussion point on leadership, resistance to change and group dynamics.
